question: Who are the Québécois?
possible_answers: A. All the French-speaking people in Canada are called Québécois.
B. They form a nation within a united Canada.
C. They are descendants of British settlers who live in Québec.
D. They are the Canadians who only speak French.
answer: B. They form a nation within a united Canada.
explanatory_sentence: The House of Commons recognized in 2006 that the Québécois form a nation within a united Canada.
